page.title: 08Hotels in Felixstowe
page.content: One of the hotels in Felixstowe is The{Orwell Moat}House.It was built in 1896 by John Corder for the{Tollemache { {family}of Helmingham Hall. It had 32 rooms to begin with and it now has 60 rooms. The Orwell Hotel was smaller than it is now and had a large garden which is now the car park.The hotel was built opposite the station because most vistors arrived by train. It is one of the most used hotels even though it is not on the sea front. It has a large room which is called the{Suffolk Suite}which is used for lots of different meetings.
